intro: Tithymalus oxyodontus, commonly known as the woolly tithymalus, is a flowering plant native to parts of southern Africa. It is characterized by its dense, woolly foliage and small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in arid or semi-arid environments. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is known for its medicinal properties in traditional herbal practices. The plant's unique appearance and adaptability to harsh conditions make it a notable species in its native habitat.
